In a study by Tang et al from Wuhan,
10 71% of nonsurvivors from COVID‐19 infection met the ISTH criteria for DIC compared with 0.4% of survivors. Elevated d‐dimer at admission and markedly increasing d‐dimer levels (three‐ to fourfold) over time were associated with high mortality, likely reflecting coagulation activation from infection/sepsis, cytokine storm, and impending multiorgan failure.
10 Furthermore, other reports showed that patients with COVID 19 and severe respiratory distress often develop complications such as liver dysfunction or renal failure which can be related to procoagulant status.
